required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Effectiveness and Safety in Hepatitis-co-infected Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Effectiveness and Safety in Hepatitis-co-infected Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to observe the tolerability and effectiveness of Kaletra in Human Immunodeficiency Virus/Hepatitis-B Virus and Human Immunodeficiency Virus/Hepatitis-C Virus co-infected patients.

primary_outcome.description: The decision to perform aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT) laboratory tests to monitor participants' liver function was left to the treating physician's clinical judgment. The mean values and standard deviations for those tested at Baseline are presented.

arm_group.description: HIV-infected patients with co-infections of Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C

study_pop.textblock: Community sample, Human Immunodeficiency Virus-infected patients with Hepatitis B or C co-infections

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients infected by HIV-1 and HBV or HCV
- Age ≥18 years
- Patients who were initiated on a LPV/r containing antiretroviral (ARV) regimen
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications as described in SmPC (summary of product characteristics) at the time of prescription

clinical_study.keyword: Co-infection with Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C

group.title: HIV-infected Participants With Hepatitis Co-infection
group.description: HIV-infected participants with co-infections of hepatitis B or hepatitis C.

group.title: HIV-infected Participants With Hepatitis Co-infection
group.description: HIV-infected participants with co-infections of hepatitis B or hepatitis C.

measure.title: Hepatitis Co-infection
measure.description: The number of participants with hepatitis B or hepatitis C co-infection.

measure.title: Duration of HIV infection
measure.description: How long participants had been diagnosed with HIV infection at Baseline. Based on 32 participants.

The mean values and standard deviations for those tested at Baseline are presented.

outcome.title: CD4 Cell Count
outcome.description: The decision to perform laboratory tests to determine participants' CD4-positive (CD4+) T-lymphocyte counts was left to the treating physician's clinical judgment. The mean and standard deviation for those tested at Baseline are presented.
outcome.population: All participants with CD4+ cell count measurements at Baseline are included.

reported_events.time_frame: Investigators were instructed to report adverse events throughout the study (up to 3 years).

group.title: HIV-infected Participants With Hepatitis Co-infection
group.description: HIV-infected participants with co-infections of hepatitis B or hepatitis C.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Abbott requests that any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, provide written notification of their request 60 days prior to their presentation/publication. Abbott requests that no presentation/publication will be instituted until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay may be proposed of a presentation/publication if Abbott needs to secure patent or proprietary protection.
